patterns: Tell me about Masinde Muliro University
responses: Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology (MMUST) is a public university in Kenya, located in Kakamega Town. It was established in 1972 and named after the late Masinde Muliro, a Kenyan freedom fighter.
MMUST is a leading institution in science and technology education in Kenya, offering various undergraduate and postgraduate programs.

patterns: What is the address of MMUST?
How do I get to MMUST?
responses: MMUST is located along Kakamega-Webuye Road in Kakamega Town, Kenya.
The main campus of Masinde Muliro University is in Kakamega, Western Kenya. The exact address is: Masinde Muliro University of Science and Technology, P.O. Box 190-50100, Kakamega, Kenya.

patterns: What can I study at MMUST?
responses:
MMUST offers a wide range of programs including: 
- Bachelor of Science in Computer Science 
- Bachelor of Education 
- Bachelor of Business Administration 
- Bachelor of Engineering 
- Bachelor of Medicine and Surgery 
- And many more in sciences, arts, and technology fields.
You can study various undergraduate and postgraduate programs in Science, Technology, Education, Business, and Health Sciences at MMUST.

Admission requirements vary by program. Generally: 
- For undergraduate: Minimum KCSE C+ or equivalent 
- For diploma: KCSE C- or equivalent 
- For postgraduate: Relevant bachelor's degree with at least Second Class Honors.
You need at least a KCSE C+ to qualify for most degree programs at MMUST. Specific programs may have higher requirements.

patterns: How do I apply to MMUST?
responses:
You can apply to MMUST through: 
1. KUCCPS for government-sponsored programs 
2. Direct online application via MMUST website for self-sponsored programs 
3. Download application forms from the MMUST website.
Applications are done online via the MMUST website or through KUCCPS for government-sponsored students.

patterns: How do i get the fee structure for mmust
How much are fees at MMUST?
How much are tuition fees at MMUST
responses:
Fees vary by program. Generally: 
- Government-sponsored: About KSh 16,000 per semester 
- Self-sponsored: KSh 45,000 - KSh 150,000 per semester depending on the course.
You can check the detailed fee structure on the MMUST website or contact the finance department for specific program fees.

patterns: how can i access more information about mmust
responses:
You can contact MMUST through: 
Phone: +254 702 597 360 / +254 725 659 308 
Email: info@mmust.ac.ke 
Website: www.mmust.ac.ke

MMUST contacts: 
Main Line: 056-31375 
Email: info@mmust.ac.ke 
Address: P.O. Box 190-50100, Kakamega, Kenya

patterns: When does the academic year start?
responses:
MMUST follows a semester system: 
- September to December (1st Semester) 
- January to April (2nd Semester) 
- May to August (3rd Semester for some programs).
The main intakes are in September and January. Check the MMUST website for the exact academic calendar dates.

patterns: How much do i pay for hostels in mmust
responses: Yes, MMUST has hostels with fees ranging from KSh 5,000 to KSh 15,000 per semester. There are also private hostels near the university.
MMUST provides both on-campus and off-campus accommodation options for students at varying costs.

patterns: How to get sponsorship at MMUST
responses: MMUST offers scholarships and bursaries to needy and bright students. You can apply through the Dean of Students' office.
There are various scholarship opportunities including government scholarships (HELB) and institutional bursaries at MMUST.

patterns: how many lecturers are in sci
responses: Currently, i only know of only 16 lecturers and five computer lab technicians in sci

patterns: What is the name of the sci dean
responses: Dr Daniel Otanga is the current dean of students in the SCI fraternity. He is always available to help all students with any issues from fees arrears to just getting to know more about what he teaches.
Dr. Odawa is a member of the sci lecturer fraternity and teaches various units ranging from systems analysis to human computer interactions
Dr. Dorothy Rambim is one of the intellectual lecturers in the Sci University. She currently teaches computer science and ETS students.
Exams, following the main calendar, usually starts in April while special and supplementary examinations start on August.

patterns: how do i get to the library when i am currently at the main gate
responses: Walk straight ahead along the pathway till you see a round-about on your right. Follow the path ahead till you reach the fountain. The building on the left is the library

patterns: how do i get to the administration block when i am at the main gate
responses: From main gate walk straight along the paved pathway till you see a roundabout on your right, branch on your right after the round about and head straight and on your left you’ll see a multi storey building with offices

patterns: how do i get to the eca building when i am at the main gate
responses: Go straight ahead along the pathway you’ll see a rugby and football pitch, continue going straight and on your left you’ll see a building with spiral ramp

patterns: how do i get to mph from the main gate
Directions to the muti purpose hall from the main gate
responses: From the gate follow the pathway on your left. You’ll see a large building with glass wall on the front right next to the rugby field.

patterns: how do i get to the school of business and economics class when i am at the main gate.
where are the school of business classes
responses: Walk straight along the runway for about 6 minutes. You’ll see a single storey building that is on your left (the building is directly opposite the lawn behind the library)
Dr Raphael Angulu is a senior lecturer of the SCI fraternity. He currently teaches C, C++, Java and neural networks in SCI. He also is the current head of SIK and IT students in SCI.

patterns: How do I apply for hostel accommodation
How do i get a hostel room
how do i apply for hostels in mmust
responses: Submit an online application via the MMUST student portal during the announced registration period. Ensure you meet deadlines and upload required documents.

patterns: Are hostels allocated on a first-come, first-served basis
responses: Priority is often given to first-year students, students with disabilities, and those from distant regions. Remaining spaces are allocated based on application timelines.

patterns: Can I choose my hostel or roommate
responses: Roommate requests may be considered during application, but final allocations depend on availability. Hostel assignments are managed by the Dean of Students’ office.

No, MMUST hostels are self-catering, students use nearby cafeterias to buy their meals.They can also pay for meal cards to get affordable meals in the school fraternity. visit the MCU building for more details on how to pay for meals

patterns: Are there installment plans for hostel fees
responses: Full payment is typically required upfront. Contact the finance office for exceptions

patterns: What facilities are in the hostels
responses: Hostels provide beds, mattresses, dustbins, curtains, study desks, shared bathrooms, and common rooms. Wi-Fi availability varies by block.

patterns: Is there 24/7 electricity and water in the hostels
responses: Basic utilities are provided, but occasional outages may occur. Report issues to the hostel caretaker.

patterns: How secure are the hostels in mmust
responses: Security guards and CCTV cameras monitor hostel premises. Students must sign in/out and adhere to curfew hours (10 PM).

patterns: What if I lose my room key
responses: Report immediately to the hostel warden. Replacement keys incur a fee (approximately Ksh 1500).

patterns: Are guests allowed to enter hostel rooms
responses: Daytime visitors are permitted in common areas only, with prior approval from the warden
No. Alcohol, drugs, and smoking are strictly prohibited.

patterns: Can I change my hostel after allocation
responses: Requests are considered only in exceptional cases (e.g., medical needs). Submit a formal appeal to the Dean of Students.

patterns: What if I’m not assigned a hostel
what do i do when all hostels are fully booked
responses: Apply for off-campus housing. The university provides a list of approved lodgings nearby

patterns: Can i stay in the hostels during the long holidays
responses: Hostels close during breaks. Special permission may be granted for academic/research purposes

patterns: How far are hostels from lecture halls
responses: Most hostels are within a 10–15 minute walk from academic buildings.

patterns: Are there hostel rooms for students with disabilities
Are there hostel rooms for disabled students
Are there hostel rooms for abled differently students
Can students who are abled differently access hostels
can disabled students get hostel rooms
responses: Yes. MMUST offers accessible rooms. Contact the Disability Services Office during application.

patterns: can a lady and a man stay in one hostel room
responses: No. Hostels are gender-segregated.

responses: there are four student hostels in mmust namely Hall 1, Hall 2, Hall 3 and Hall 4. Each rooms in the different have varying prices, different accommodations and are located in different parts of the campus.

patterns: How do you check your fee balance
What steps do you take to view your fee balance
Can you guide me on how to access my fee balance
What's the process for checking my fee balance
Is there a way to see my outstanding fee balance
Where can I check my fee balance information
Can I be shown how to view my fee balance online
What's the procedure for looking up my fee balance
Can you tell me how to check my fee balance
responses: To check your fee balance, a student must visit the mmust students portal through the link portal.mmust.ac.ke and login to your account. In the students dashboard, click on the sidebar, click finance then click fees. you should find your fee balance there. You can also see the fee balance on the students dashboard

patterns: Can i change the course i was allocated to in mmust
responses: A student can change the course he was allocated to only in first year. To do so , a student must first go and fill in the student form provided in orange house and if the student met all necessary requirements to join the course and the course is still taking in students, the student can successfully change his course. Note that not all courses take in students as they have reached the maximum number they can teach
The finance office is located at orange house(Administration Block)

patterns: Where is the school clinic located
responses: The school clinic is located between LBB and the auditorium (MEA). Just walk straight from the main gate  along the paved pathway for about 8 minutes and after reaching the LBB building , the building next to this is the clinic

Walk straight from the main gate for about 5 minutes. You should come across a junction and on your right there should be some kiosks and on your left there should be the school of business and economics offices and MEA or auditorium. The LBB building is the next big building you see just after the auditorium

patterns: who is the current vice chancellor
responses: Professor Solomon Shibairo

patterns: How do i check for units in the mmust portal
responses: To check registered units at MMUST:Log in to MMUST Student Portal ,Go to Academic Records >units > Unit history > Select your year of study , View your units

patterns: How to login to mmust odel
how do i log in to mmust odel
responses: To access MMUST ODeL, visit https://odel.mmust.ac.ke/ for admissions and resources. Log in via https://mmust.mycportal.com/ or reset your password at https://elearning.mmust.ac.ke/login/forgot_password.php. Use the portal for academic materials, library access, and research. For support, email odel@mmust.ac.ke or studentsupport@mmust.ac.ke. Ensure you meet admission requirements before applying. Always log out after use for security.
Main catering Unit (MCU) is located near gate C.
Steve is a lecturer in mmust specifically in the deopartent of Computer Science
